oai_dc:dc.dc:title: SYNTHESIS, CHARACTERIZATION, CYTOTOXICITY AND DNA-BINDING STUDIES OF DIAMMINEDIETHYLDITHIOCARBAMATOPLATINUM(II) NITRATE
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: JAIN, N
PAUL, AK
SRIVASTAVA, TS
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: platinum(ii) complexes
diethyldithiocarbamate
toxicity
diamine
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A new complex [Pt(NH3)2(ddtc)]NO3.2H2O as a 1:1 electrolyte has been prepared. This was characterized by spectroscopic methods. The electronic absorption spectrum of this complex in water suggests that it has a square planar geometry. The infrared, H-1 NMR and x-ray photoelectron spectroscopic studies suggest the bonding of ammonia molecules and diethyldithiocarbamate as bidentate ligand to platinum(II) in this complex. The 50% inhibition value of this complex against P388 lympocytic leukemia cells is comparable with cisplatin. This complex interacts with calf thymus DNA by coordinate covalent bond.
